FIELD OFFICE TAIPEI, TAIWAN. P. O. BOX NO. 23 TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS WHITENGECO, TAIPEI.
THE J. G. WHITE ENGINEERING CORPORATION ENGINEERS AND CONSTRUCTORS 8 O BROAD STREET / NEW YORK 4, N. Y.
TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS WHITENGECO, NEW YORK
年
April 26, 1962 File Ref. MSA-33.4
Mr. C. C. Chang, Chief Second Division Council for United States Aid Taipei, Taiwan
Subject : Excess Equipment
Project No. 84-99-471
Dear Mr. Chang;
Attached hereto are two (2) copies each of lists of items secured from "On-shore" locations, up to and including the first week in April, 1962, lists having been submitted by THB and PWB.
Both these recipients are concerned that they may, sometime in the future, be charged with having obtained certain items that have appeared on various purchase orders, which, at the time of delivery proved to be "not- available".
140.112.213.82
While it is true that certain items were found to be non-available, after purchase orders were issued; due to duplication or incorrect earlier delivery to other recipients, these items are in a minority.
To relieve these recipients of responsibility for items that had proved unavailable, we have made a thorough study of the submitted lists, comparing same with our own memoranda and agree that these lists of "Received Items" are as reasonably accurate as could be prepared.
Very truly yours, THE J. G. WHITE ENGINEERING CORPORATION
GEO/ks Att.

G. E. Otto Spec. Writer & Bid Analyst

paragraphs.content: FIELD OFFICE TAIPEI, TAIWAN. P. O. BOX NO. 23 TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS WHITENGECO, TAIPEI.
THE J. G. WHITE ENGINEERING CORPORATION ENGINEERS AND CONSTRUCTORS 8 O BROAD STREET / NEW YORK 4, N. Y.
Mr. C. C. Chang, Chief Second Division Council for United States Aid Taipei, Taiwan
Attached hereto are two (2) copies each of lists of items secured from "On-shore" locations, up to and including the first week in April, 1962, lists having been submitted by THB and PWB.

Both these recipients are concerned that they may, sometime in the future, be charged with having obtained certain items that have appeared on various purchase orders, which, at the time of delivery proved to be "not- available".

While it is true that certain items were found to be non-available, after purchase orders were issued; due to duplication or incorrect earlier delivery to other recipients, these items are in a minority.

To relieve these recipients of responsibility for items that had proved unavailable, we have made a thorough study of the submitted lists, comparing same with our own memoranda and agree that these lists of "Received Items" are as reasonably accurate as could be prepared.
Very truly yours, THE J. G. WHITE ENGINEERING CORPORATION
G. E. Otto Spec. Writer & Bid Analyst
cc : THB PWB JHHulse, JGW Reports Sec., JGW
